p: Spectroelectrochemical studies provided more insight into the structures of the species that are formed upon reduction of 1 and 2. Linear sweep voltammetry of 1, while probing the IR spectrum, reveals bleaching of IR signals associated to the neutral complex, concomitant with the appearance of new red‐shifted bands assigned to the reduced species 1 – (Figure 5a). The absorption‐difference spectra show a small band growing in at 1730 cm –1, which is characteristic for reduced diiron compounds with a bridging carbonyl ligand. 27, 28 Complex 2 shows similar bands in its IR spectrum upon reduction (Figure 5b).
